website_summaries.verdict: This percolator can either work over a fire or a camp-stove and makes enough coffee for the whole crew.
pros: Lasts through heavy use in outdoor elements
Can be placed on an open fire
cons: It can take a while for your coffee to fully brew
The handle gets hot and you will need a hot pad

customer_reviews.title: Coffee and cream
customer_reviews.text: This bad boy delivers liquid ambrosia in the wilderness. How do you not love it. Not only does it provide you and your spouse a wonderful kick start to your day but to all your friends as well. Only those slackers forgot coffee cups, coffee, sugar, and cream so they have to use yours and share cups. Or they have to improvise with solo cups but the coffee is blistering hot and almost melts the cups so they have to drink it really fast just to hold the cup. So it all so provides entertainment while sipping your brew. My husband recommends using Baileys Irish Cream while using this.
customer_reviews.author: Craft Family

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: It’s a lightweight aluminum camp percolator. It was cheap so I bought it because I wanted to have a 20 cup percolator if I needed it. I have no great expectations for it. I’ll use it until it wears out. If you want top quality, this is not for you. Buy an expensive, high quality, stainless steel pot if you want one that will last a lifetime. You get what you paid for with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good camping percolator
customer_reviews.text: Hot coffee was pivotal in happy camping mornings. This pot allowed us to make a ton of coffee so we could have more than one cup, was easy to wash out the grounds at the site, and pretty straight forward to use. We put it over an open fire and it worked great and cleaned up well once we got home and cleaned it up with a Brillo pad. I would highly recommend using percolator filters and a coarser grind if you want to keep grinds out of your morning cup of joe. Bottom line, was 100% glad we bought this and brought it with us.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the percolator but somewhat satisfied with it as a coffee pot.
customer_reviews.text: First tried this percolator at home on my stove - it ended up not percolating very well, so I tried it again with smaller grinds - which after 20 minutes of hard boiling it still did not produce results. Took it camping a few days ago without the percolator, and just used it to boil water. The plastic cap melted off from the fire, but aside from that, the pot got the job done. I'll be using it to boil hot water and discard the percolator contraption.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Chang

customer_reviews.title: It leaks!
